name: 5-tert-butyl-2-methyl-3-furoic acid
Reason: 5-tert-butyl-2-methyl-3-furoic acid has a melting point influenced by functional groups relative to the base melting point of benzene, which is around 5°C. The basic unit for comparison can be furan, which has a melting point of -32.0 degrees Celsius. The methyl group introduces a rigid structure, which can participate in dipole interactions and raise the melting point by approximately +5 degrees Celsius. The tert-butyl group introduces a bulky structure, which can increase the melting point due to steric hindrance and molecular weight. The carbonyl group introduces polar carbonyl interactions, contributing approximately +40°C. The methoxy group introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and raise the melting point by approximately +5 degrees Celsius. The furanyl ring introduces additional rigid structures that can participate in dipole interactions and raise the melting point by approximately +20 degrees Celsius.
